oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sensorless control of induction motor using fast output sampling technique
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ABERA, AGE
BANDYOPADHYAY, B
AGARWAL V
JANARDHANAN, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: induction machine
sensorless control
multirate output feedback
fast output sampling and speed control
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper presents the design of a new technique for induction motor control without using speed sensor. Here the discrete time control technique is used to design the controller for induction motor drive. The non-linear model of an induction motor is revisited here and linearized about an operating point to obtain a linear model for the same. A fast output sampling based controller is obtained by considering the stator current as output only. The non-linear model of the induction motor is simulated with the proposed controller. This method does not require the states of the system for feedback and is easily implementable.
